title: What if Urgot ults below 20% Tryndamere?
body: So if Urgot ulted a below 20% who used ult, does Tryndamere still die and get grinded into pieces? That's the question for today lol.

replies.body: I think currently what happens in cases like these is that we give the advantage to the defender. BelugaWhale has been resisting mine and Riot Sotere's pushes to get him to make Urgot's ult "true death" as we like to call it, at least for the time being.

Yeah it could make sense in this context, but it could also get arms race-ish, I suppose.

Well, to be fair, those champions are kind of old and in Tryndamere's case, he's very binary, you either win really hard or lose really hard, no inbetween and his ultimate is kind of...unfun? I think it would be nice to actually be able to punish a Kayle or Tryndamere instead of their ults letting them get out scot free after a mistake. 

On a side note, revival abilities, invulnerabilities, did you guys discuss making Urgot cancel those abilities(not put them on cooldown but prevent them from working if the enemy is in execution range.)
We've discussed it. I imagine the spell would be rather controversial if we were to go through with it though.

I think it'd be fair for it to be a true death ability, because unlike many other executes (garen ult, veigar ult, chogath ult) it's a skillshot, and 25% hp is lower than what most of these other ults can execute from.  Not to mention it's QSS-able too! It has more than enough counterplay IMO.

The problem with that logic, in my opinion, is that the missile already moves at 3200 speed or some nonsense like that. From my experience with playing against Urgot in lane, you’re not going to be half a lane away from him when he uses ult. You’re going to be right there, in their face, and unless the Urgot misclicks or you get the most clutch Flash, it’s gonna hit you. What’s more, the lock on duration for his ult is also a mind game, because it lasts for so long. Having played Kayle against Urgot myself, at almost all levels, your ult duration is nowhere as long as his. He can just bait you into using ult and still punish you, anyways.

His ult is fine how it is.

You've embraced other controversial choices - like letting Braum and Yasuo use relatively low cooldown basic abilities to completely nullify the long cooldown ultimates of other champions.

Why should ultimates for champs like Tryndamere or Kayle be so special? Just because they're "defensive" ultimates? What does that even mean?

Both champions frequently use their ultimates' invulnerability for offense, not defense. And conversely, an Ashe arrow or a Lux ult can be used defensively instead of offensively, but it still gets shut down by a Windwall? How is that consistent?

I play a lot of Yasuo when I can(when he's not already picked or banned, which in my Plastic 5 elo is like all the time) and I fully understand and agree with Lux's ult not being affected by his windwall.   

Other projectile abilities, yeah, that's what it's for, but only an idiot would expect that little wall of wind to block that kamehameha blast.

How about Braum's ult, which is an underground fissure? Logically, that shouldn't be blocked, but because the game flags it as a "projectile", it is.

What about Lux's other light based abilities, that windwall DOES block, because they're classed as "projectiles"?

There's no logical consistency with regards to in-world explanation for abilities. One light based attack is blocked by wind, but another isn't. One attack that goes under the wind wall is blocked by it, but others aren't. All because of the engine flagging them as being "projectiles", and Riot not bothering to code in exceptions that make sense.

#WAIT!
Can Urgot use {{item:3157}} to 100% execute targets, once they drop too low?
{{item:3193}} sure he can

Thing is, the match would devolve into one interaction.

"Can Trynd dodge Urgot ult?"

Most of the time, the answer will be no; the hitbox on that drill is rather generous, and Trynd is generally deep enough that anyone with skillshots only has to hit them at point blank.

Killing Kayle through her ult is somewhat reasonable, since she can ult early to keep herself above the threshold or ult right before the drill hits. It's skill reliant.

Trynd, though? His ult doesn't stop him from going below 25%, and he gets no value out of it if he isn't at 1 HP. He can't do shit to make his ultimate useful if Urgot gave "True Death".

It's his most important skill, and it would be a dead ability.

But every match up devolves into a singular thing with tryndamere.

"Will tryndamere be able to kill his opponent before his ult timer runs out."

The thing is, this is extremely binary, he's extremely outdated is the main issue though but what difference would it make in the end if tryndamere could still be killed by urgot? So it really doesn't matter if Urgot could kill tryndamere through his ultimate, it wouldn't really change the match up at all it would just require tryndamere to actually think before jumping on someone, right clicking and remembering to press R before dying. Even if urgot couldn't kill him through his ultimate, tryndamere would still use it regardless, because that all his matchups consist of. Right-click someone, jump on them, press R and if you fail to kill them, farm up. He'd play the match up exactly the same regardless.
We have supports
No amount of supporting is going to keep a glass cannon above 25% HP while they are wading through the enemy team.
